title: Help Me Understand
body:
I was given a 10-game chat restriction. 

They give me a little paragraph or two about how we need to be more positive and mature then sent me a list of what I said. 

Can someone please read what I said and tell me what I did wrong? I was playing a meta-support (Leona) building myself correctly with more assists/kills than deaths. I was warding and helping my team. What did I say that was "toxic" or "nasty" and makes me a bad person to the community? 

I was insulted. I was called stupid, a feeder, a troll, an idiot, and so on. I never reacted with an insult or put anyone down. 

Was me saying " omfg aatrox :/ " considered toxic when he dived a 1v3 and got 1-shot by the enemy team? 

Help me understand what I can do better. It's just not clicking with me.

Thank you! :)

Zavolk: thanks for backing me up - these 4 are legit blaming me for everything - i don't get it

Zavolk: you're kidding me right?

replies.body: Passive-aggressive bitching is still flaming and distracting to your team.

> Passive-aggressive bitching is still flaming and distracting to your team.



Please don't curse. I don't want you accidentally getting in trouble even though you are trying to help me by providing feedback.

Cursing isn't prohibited. Being passive aggressive (or any form of aggressive) or negative towards your teammates is.

If others are insulting you, the proper response is to mute them and report them at the end - not to be negative and "tilting".

To be completely honest, yes. There is absolutely no reason you must "stand up for yourself" in League - it just perpetuates negativity and turns one toxic asshole into one toxic asshole and someone being negative back to them. Don't argue, don't fight, and don't "defend" yourself - just mute them and move on.

At that point why stop there, why not crawl up in a hole and die? That way I won't perpetuate negativity with my "self defense" and "passive aggressive" behavior that is ruining games for, as you call them, "toxic assholes." Your advice is like the time my friend realized there was a burgler in his house so he called the police and they told him to just let the burglar do his thing until he leaves because while there _**are **_ police in the area they are "busy patrolling" when the purpose of "patrolling" is supposed to be having people nearby in case something happens. To take things further for the sake of showing how incredibly ignorant this logic is in practice, I guess all those people who survived the recent shooting should've just opened the doors and let the shooter in because they ruined his experience by "defending themselves" with walls.

You are thinking of this system as a traditional court system, where you have two sides trying to prove others to be guilty/innocent, but the system doesn't work that way.

Every game you are reported, the system checks for toxicity and grades it. 0= no toxicity and 100 is like to use of hate speech. So if your toxicity grade reached 100, you will be punished. When others are toxic to you and you report them, they will get a grade and get punished depending on where they are on the behavior scale.



 I would grade passive aggressiveness to be on a scale of like ... 5? Meaning you have had similar behavior over quite a handful of games, and this was the game that took you over 100, thus you were punished. 

Btw, you'll get the same grade regardless of how many people report you, and remember that false reports will give you a 0 grade. So don't worry about getting falsely reported or mass reported.

Your attitude before you started giving up was pretty good, so if you follow that beginning attitude, you'll be fine.

I think it was the absolute loss of morale that you spread into chat. You just gave up. Constant negativity... "I'm done" several times, "I shouldn't support at this mmr" "I'm not gonna support kids who haven't even been gold 5" "enjoy your loss". You basically condescended to your entire team, saying you're the best player there, and they don't even know how to play. Avoid this.
Hokey Dokey <3
I would point the reason behind the punishment to the attitude you had including (and after) the point where you gave up in chat.
